  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Detail

      • clickOn

        public static boolean clickOn(android.view.View view)

        Calls performClick() on a View after ensuring that it and its ancestors are visible and that it is enabled.

        Parameters:
        view - the view to click on
        Returns:
        true if View.OnClickListeners were found and fired, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the preconditions are not met.

      • visualize

        public static java.lang.String visualize(android.view.View view)

        Returns a textual representation of the appearance of the object.

        Parameters:
        view - the view to visualize
        Returns:
        Textual representation of the appearance of the object.

        Parameters:

      • getQualifiers

        @Deprecated
protected java.lang.String getQualifiers()
        Deprecated. 

        This will be removed in Robolectric 3.4 use RuntimeEnvironment.getQualifiers() instead, however the correct way to configure qualifiers is using Config.qualifiers() so a constant can be used if this is important to your tests. However, qualifier strings are typically just used to initialize the test environment in a certain configuration. Configuration changes should be managed through ActivityController.configurationChange(android.content.res.Configuration)

      • getBackgroundResourceId

        @Deprecated
public int getBackgroundResourceId()
        Deprecated. Use FEST assertions instead.
        Returns:
        the resource ID of this view’s background

      • getBackgroundColor

        @Deprecated
public int getBackgroundColor()
        Deprecated. Use FEST assertions instead.
        Returns:
        the color of this view’s background, or 0 if it’s not a solid color

      • checkedPerformClick

        public boolean checkedPerformClick()

        Utility method for clicking on views exposing testing scenarios that are not possible when using the actual app.

        Returns:
        Return value of the underlying click operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the view is disabled or if the view or any of its parents are not visible.
